title: Land on a very challenging updated airport in Columbia: Mateca침a International Airport
description:
Mateca침a International Airport (Spanish: Aeropuerto Internacional de Mateca침a, IATA: PEI, ICAO: SKPE) serves the city of Pereira, Colombia, and acts as an alternate airport for Armenia, Cartago, Manizales, Medell칤n, Cali, and Bogot치. 

Positioned on the brink of a deep ravine, the airport is located 2 kilometers (1.2 miles) west of Pereira, with steep drop-offs surrounding the runway and high terrain encompassing all quadrants except the south.

Approaching this airport presents a notable challenge due to the significant elevation difference between the runway's end and the surrounding area. Nevertheless, upon landing, visitors can appreciate the intricately detailed terminal interior and the static display of scenery objects in the hangar. For an added experience, a nighttime landing showcases the airport's enhanced lighting system.

For a full overview of items added to the marketplace this week have a look at the video below:
